description: Each week, guests and hosts on NPR's Pop Culture Happy Hour share what's bringing them joy. This week: The Cure's Songs of a Lost World, a lawn mowing simulator video game, and fall yard work.
title: What's Making Us Happy: A guide to your weekend raking, listening and gaming

description: U.S. employers added just 12,000 jobs last month — but the number was depressed by a machinists' strike at Boeing and Hurricanes Helene and Milton.
title: Employers added only 12,000 jobs in October. That seems bad -- but there's a catch

description: In a film that has powerful moments of wonderment, humor and joy, Saoirse Ronan plays a London factory worker trying to protect her young son as German bombs fall across the city.
title: A mother and son are separated by the London 'Blitz' in this quietly radical film

description: The Cure's first album in 16 years, Songs of a Lost World, is thematically dark, but sonically rich and inviting. Still, though, Robert Smith says there's so much more to come.
title: ‘How it will end is how it will end,’ but The Cure isn’t over, yet

description: In his new play The Other Americans, John Leguizamo stars as a Colombian American laundromat owner whose son is released from a mental wellness facility after suffering a trauma. The play's world premiere is at Arena Stage in Washington, D.C.
title: John Leguizamo's parents knew the 'American dream hustle.' That informed his new play

description: The U.S. says 8,000 North Korean soldiers are in Russia preparing to fight against Ukrainian troops in the coming days.
title: U.S. calls on a silent China to use its sway over Russia and North Korea
